users.title: User Management
users.subtitle: Create, edit and manage users

info.title: Who Can Do What?
info.description: Manage user accounts and their access rights. Three roles available: 'Viewer' can only read, 'Editor' can edit data and start crawls, 'Admin' has full access including user management. Each user only sees areas they are authorized for.

emptyState.title: No users
emptyState.description: No users have been created yet.

dialog.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this user?

users.passwordNotValid: Password does not meet all requirements
users.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete user {email}? This action cannot be undone.

info.title: What Happened When?
info.description: The change history documents all user actions and system events - from logins to data changes to crawl jobs. Useful for security review, error analysis, or simply to understand who did what. Tip: Filter by user, action type, or time period to find specific activities.

emptyState.title: No entries
emptyState.description: No audit log entries have been recorded yet.

clear.title: Clear Audit Log
clear.warning: This action is irreversible. All deleted entries cannot be recovered.
clear.deleteOlderThan: Only delete entries older than date

entityTypes.title: Entity Types
entityTypes.subtitle: Manage categories for entities (e.g. municipalities, persons, organizations)

info.title: The Foundation of Your Data
info.description: Entity types are the categories for your records - like 'Municipality', 'Person', 'Organization' or 'Wind Farm'. Each type can have its own icon, color, and associated facet types. The order determines display in the interface. Tip: System types cannot be deleted but can be deactivated.

emptyState.title: No entity types
emptyState.description: No entity types have been created yet. Create your first entity type to get started.

form.name: Name
form.descriptionPlaceholder: Brief description of the entity type
form.iconHint: Use Material Design Icons (mdi-*). See materialdesignicons.com
form.supportsPysisHint: Enables PySis integration for entities of this type
form.isActiveHint: Inactive types are no longer displayed
form.facetsInfo: Select the facet types that should be available for this entity type. Facets with an empty entity type filter apply to all types.

dialog.deleteConfirm: Do you really want to delete {name}? This action cannot be undone.

entityTypes.facetsHint: Facet types available for this entity type

facetTypes.title: Facet Types
facetTypes.subtitle: Manage attributes and properties for entity types

info.title: Flexible Attributes for Your Data
info.description: Facet types define what information can be captured for records - like 'Mayor', 'Founding Date', 'Location' or 'Pain Points'. Each facet type can be linked to specific entity types and automatically extracted by AI. Tip: Enable 'AI Extraction' and provide a prompt - then the AI will automatically find relevant values in documents.

emptyState.title: No facet types
emptyState.description: No facet types have been created yet. Create your first facet type to define properties for your data.

form.name: Name
form.entityTypesHint: Select which entity types this facet applies to
form.applicableEntityTypesHint: Empty = applies to all entity types
form.valueSchemePlaceholder: Enter JSON schema for value structure...
form.schemaInfo: The JSON schema defines the structure of values for this facet type
form.aiExtractionEnabledHint: Automatic extraction by AI from documents
form.aiExtractionPromptPlaceholder: Extract the following information from the document...
form.aiPromptInfo: The AI prompt is used to extract relevant information from documents.
form.aiDisabledInfo: AI extraction is disabled. Enable it to automatically extract data from documents.
form.aiSchemaGeneratorHint: Generate schema, prompt and settings automatically based on name and description
form.allowsEntityReferenceHint: Facet values can be linked to entities
form.autoCreateEntityHint: Automatically create an entity when a facet value is added
form.targetEntityTypesHint: Which entity types can be referenced
form.entityRefInfo: Entity references allow linking facet values to entities for better data modeling.
form.entityRefDisabledInfo: Enable entity references to link facet values to entities.
form.schemaPlaceholder: Enter JSON schema for value structure...

dialog.deleteConfirm: Do you really want to delete {name}? This action cannot be undone.

messages.schemaGenerated: Schema and settings have been generated

dialog.title: Review Facet Type
dialog.approveConfirm: Approve this facet type? It will then be available to all users.
dialog.rejectConfirm: Reject this facet type? It will be deactivated and no longer used.
dialog.mergeConfirm: Which facet type should "{name}" be merged with?

apiTemplates.title: API Templates
apiTemplates.subtitle: Manage reusable API configurations for AI discovery

info.title: Reuse API Configurations
info.description: API templates store tested configurations for external APIs (OParl, REST, SPARQL). During AI search, matching templates are automatically suggested. Keywords determine when a template matches. Tip: Save successful API configurations as templates for future searches.

form.name: Name
form.descriptionPlaceholder: Brief description of the API template
form.fieldMappingHint: Mapping from API fields to standard fields
form.keywordsHint: Words for automatic matching in search queries

dialog.deleteConfirm: Do you really want to delete "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.

apiTemplates.noTemplatesHint: Create a new template or save one from AI Discovery

crawlPresets.title: Crawl Presets
crawlPresets.emptyHint: Save filter configurations as presets for quick re-execution
crawlPresets.name: Name
crawlPresets.noFavoritesHint: Mark presets as favorites for quick access
crawlPresets.deleteConfirm: Do you really want to delete the preset "{name}"?

llmUsage.title: LLM Usage
llmUsage.subtitle: Token usage and cost analysis for AI models

analytics.infoCompact: Analyze LLM usage by time period, user, task type, and model.

infoBox.description: This dashboard shows LLM usage (token consumption and costs) across all AI features of the system.
infoBox.featureAnalytics: Usage analytics by time period, model, task type, and category
infoBox.featureCharts: Trend charts and cost distribution for better insights
infoBox.featureBudgets: Budget configuration with alerts and optional blocking on limit
infoBox.featureUsers: Per-user consumption overview with API credentials status
infoBox.budgetInfo: Budgets can be defined globally, per user, per category, per task type, or per model. When blocking is enabled, LLM access is automatically restricted when 100% of the budget is reached.

tables.byUserHint: Token usage and costs per user with API credentials status

budget.title: Budgets
budget.noBudgetsHint: Create a budget to monitor your LLM costs and receive notifications when thresholds are exceeded.
budget.deleteConfirm: Do you really want to delete the budget "{name}"?
budget.warningAlert: One or more budgets have exceeded the warning threshold.
budget.criticalWarning: ATTENTION: One or more budgets have exceeded the critical threshold!

typeDescriptions.global: Total budget for all LLM usage

info.title: How LLM Budgets Work
info.overview: Budgets allow you to monitor and control your LLM costs. You can receive warnings at certain thresholds and optionally block access when the budget is exhausted.
info.typeGlobal: Total budget for all LLM usage of the instance
info.typeTaskType: Budget for a task type (e.g., SmartQuery, Assistant)
info.typeModel: Budget for a specific LLM model
info.blockingDescription: When enabled, LLM access is blocked for the affected scope once 100% of the budget is reached. Without this option, the budget only serves for monitoring and notifications.

form.name: Name
form.blocksOnLimitHint: Block LLM access when 100% of budget is reached

apiCredentials.title: API Credentials
apiCredentials.subtitle: Manage your personal API keys for external services

info.title: Personal API Credentials
info.description: These API keys are stored encrypted and used for your crawl jobs, AI features, and source discovery. Each user must configure their own keys.

sections.searchDescription: APIs for AI-powered source discovery. These are used to automatically find relevant OParl sources on the web.
sections.aiDescription: APIs for document analysis, summaries and intelligent features. At least one LLM provider must be configured.

serpapi.name: SerpAPI
serpapi.description: Google Search API for AI-powered source discovery.
serpapi.useCases: Automatic search for OParl endpoints and municipal data sources on the web.

serper.name: Serper
serper.description: Alternative Google Search API with lower pricing.
serper.useCases: Used as alternative to SerpAPI. Only one search API is required.

azure_openai.name: Azure OpenAI
azure_openai.description: Microsoft Azure hosted OpenAI Service with enterprise features.
azure_openai.useCases: Document analysis, summaries, embeddings for semantic search, AI assistant and Smart Query.

openai.name: OpenAI
openai.description: Direct access to OpenAI API (not Azure).
openai.useCases: Alternative to Azure OpenAI. Easier setup, but without enterprise features.

anthropic.name: Anthropic Claude
anthropic.description: Claude models from Anthropic for complex analyses.
anthropic.useCases: Extended API discovery, Plan Mode for complex queries and detailed document analyses.

dialog.deleteConfirm: Do you really want to delete these API credentials? Features using this service will no longer work.

llmConfig.title: AI Configuration
llmConfig.subtitle: Configure AI providers for each purpose

info.title: Purpose-based AI Configuration
info.description: Choose the appropriate AI provider for each purpose. For example, you can use Azure OpenAI for document analysis and Anthropic for the assistant.

webSearch.fallbackHint: SerpAPI is used as the primary search provider; Serper is used as a fallback if SerpAPI fails or quota is exhausted.
webSearch.atLeastOne: Please provide at least one API key.

dialog.deleteConfirm: Do you really want to delete this configuration? The corresponding service will no longer work.

info.title: Price Data Sources
info.description: Azure prices are synced automatically every week. OpenAI and Anthropic prices must be maintained manually as no public APIs are available.

emptyState.title: No pricing data available
emptyState.description: Sync prices to load current model pricing.

actions.syncTooltip: Sync current prices (Azure API + LiteLLM for OpenAI/Anthropic)

dialog.deleteConfirm: Do you really want to mark the price entry for "{model}" as deprecated?

officialUrls.title: Official Pricing Pages
officialUrls.hint: Find current prices on the official pricing pages of the providers
